name: Alchemy, technology and quotidian life:
description: Our thesis project won an honorific mention at the National design contest 2021 "Diseña México" in the master's degree category.

name: Interactive infographic
description: This interactive infographic was made to share all the breakthoughts and achievements accomplished during the realization of the thesis “Alchemy, technology and quotidian life: Interactive museography for the Leonora Carrington House Studio” that was a extensive research of Leonora’s Carrington life beyond her artist facet.

name: Interactive painting
description:
In this project Leonora Carrington’s painting “Grandmother Moorhead’s aromatic kitchen” was was intervened to create a interactive physical painting.  
  
 The painting elements were traced with Autocad and  cutted in 3mm MDF, the canvas was a box were on the inside all the mechanism, wires and gears were placed, and in the front, the paintin was sliced so the characters were in different planes. 
  
 Through image processing with OpenCV, the program identifies the color of some determinated elements related to kitchen an cooking, and when these elements are showed in the camera, the painting responds with some movement of the characters or the lighting of some elements. 
  
  Using Processing and p5.js as mediator between OpenCV and Arduino, when a stablished color range signal was received, an action was sent to an Arduino uno board and this one triggered a led or servo, that was placed carefully to simulate the activy the character would be doing.

name: Leonora Carrington House Signage
description:
As a side project of the research masters degree project “Alchemy, technology and quotidian life: Interactive museography for the Leonora Carrington House Studio” , A co-worker and I were requested to create the signage for the aforementioned  house studio museum. 
  
  The assigment consisted of, based on Leonora’s artwork create a signage system to be implemented in vinyl cutting in the museum doors.
mainImageAria: Picture of America posing with a door with her signage design

name: Dancing Bars
description:
This was one of my very fist experiments ever, it was my final project for a universitary course and the reason I felt in love with programming. 
  
  It was made with P5.js in Processing and it consist of a dancing bar matrix that can be modified by the user through some controllers that manage the bar’s height, speed, color, direction and flow as well as the matriz size.
mainImageAria: Screenshow of a p5.js program that shows a color bar matrix

name: The alchemyc kitchen
description:
I love doing research and sometimes, the unexpected comes along, in this case, while researching about Leonora Carrington’s life, diggin into books written by her and about her, interviewing her cousing and speacially her housekeeper, Yolanda Gudiño,  we discovered her magical link to food, cooking and the kitchen space itself. 
  
 We were able to gather some recipes she grew with, the ones that she cooked herself, her favorite dishes and the food she shared with her loved ones.
  
 Working along professional chefs, and the director of the “Leonora Carrington’s House Studio” we recreate the recipes. 
 
 The book illustrations were made by ouselfs, first experiment was attempting to look like scientific illustrations, but at the end a engraved style was made. 
  
 And from all that magic, this book was born.
mainImageAria: Cover of the book The alchemic kitchen

name: Interactive Experience Book
description: Participated in this book within Chapter 3: Interactive experience, with the article "Alchemy, technology, and quotidian life: Interactive museography for the Leonora Carrington House Studio" which relates the research process of creating an interactive museography project for the museum. This project is featured in the book "EXPERIENCE DESIGN Korea & Latin America Research Exchange".
mainImageAria: Cover of the book EXPERIENCE DESIGN Korea & Latin America Research Exchange

name: FILIJ Poster
description:
In 2019 participated in the XXXI National poster contest “Let’s invite to read” as part of the celebration of the International children's and juvenile book fair (FILIJ).  
  
  My artwork was in the selection to be exhibit during the book Fair.
mainImageAria: Poster with a kid and a cat reading a book

name: Poster contest To death with a smile
description:
Participated in the international poster contest “A la muerte con una sonrisa”, the objective of this contest is that international artists to share their vision of death. 
  
  On 2018 my artwork, inspired on the traditional day of the dead altar and the visit of our beloved’s souls, was selected as finalist and  exhibit in Mexican Museum of Design (MUMEDI)
mainImageAria: Poster of the contest with a cat among candles

name: Anish Kapoor contest
description:
In 2016 the Universitary Museum of Contemporary Arts (MUAC) organized a contest for university students with the occasion of the exhibition of Anish Kapoor in the aforementioned museum.  
  
 Participated in the contest and made it to the 10 finalist selection .

name: MACSO
description:
This project was a commission of the UAEMEX, an university in Mexico State. They wanted to improve their actual website of their Computational Sciences Degree. http://www.macscouaemex.mx/ 
 
 Saddly, for budget and bureaucracy the redesign project didn’t procceed.But here is some of the process and insights:  
   
 About information design: There is repeated information in different sections, broken links and unnecessary PDFs which could be replaced by content on the page. To simplify and improve the navigation was suggested to re structure the current information into new and more intuitive sections.
   
The logo was not redesigned, but lines and color were improved for legibility.
mainImageAria: Screenshot of MACSO proposal langing page

name: RADIOMED
description:
This project was made during a JAVA bootcamp, to reinforce the backend stills. In this project my team created a web e-commerce application for a new company called Radiomed focused in selling medical radiologic supplies .
  
 While the development was a team work, I personally worked the branding of the company and the Figma prototype. The Front end was developed with javascript, HTML, CSS & Bootstrap. And the Back end programmed with JAVA and Springboot framework. 
   
 All the design and development was tailored to client’s needs
